content:
Re: First cut at Functional Requirements document

Daniel W. Connolly (connolly@w3.org)
Sun, 09 Jun 1996 23:47:46 -0400

  • Messages sorted by: [ date ][ thread ][ subject ][ author ]
  • Next message: Larry Masinter: "Re: First cut at Functional Requirements document"
  • Previous message: Daniel W. Connolly: "Re: version management and relative links"
  • Maybe in reply to: David J. Fiander: "First cut at Functional Requirements document"
  • Next in thread: Larry Masinter: "Re: First cut at Functional Requirements document" 
In message <15972.834374872@worf.mks.com>, "David J. Fiander" writes:
>    <TITLE>Functional Requirements for Specifying Document Revision
>      Information in HTTP URLs</title>

Isn't this a case of assuming the conclusion? I thought we were
after functional requirements for "versioning on the web" or
"Versioning in HTTP" from which we might deduce the conclusion
that URLs must contain revision info.

Dan
